00058 #include "Metric/Metric.h"

00066 int 
00067 Metric::Levenshtein( const vector<bool> &a, const vector<bool> &b )
00068 {
00069   register int   i, j;
00070   int            dL;
00071   int            rows= a.size();
00072   int            columns= b.size();
00073   int          **table= new int*[ rows ];
00074 
00075   for ( i= 0; i<rows; i++ ) {
00076         table[ i ] = new int[ columns ];
00077         table[ i ][ 0 ]= i;
00078   }
00079   for ( j= 0; j<columns; j++ )
00080         table[ 0 ][ j ]= j;
00081 
00082   for( j= 1; j<columns; j++ ) {
00083         for( i= 1; i<rows; i++ ) {
00084           table[ i ][ j ]= min( 1 + table[i][j-1], 1 + table[i-1][j],
00085                                                     !(a[i-1]==b[j-1]) + table[i-1][j-1]
00086                                                   );
00087         }
00088   }
00089   dL= table[ rows-1 ][ columns-1 ];
00090 
00091   for ( i= 0; i<rows; i++ )
00092         delete [ ] table[ i ];
00093   delete [] table;
00094 
00095   return( dL );
00096 }

00105 int
00106 Metric::Levenshtein( const char *a, const char *b )
00107 {
00108   register unsigned i;
00109   vector< bool > va( strlen( a ) );
00110   vector< bool > vb( strlen( b ) );
00111   
00112   // copy da strings into the vectors
00113   for ( i= 0; i<va.size(); ++i )
00114         va[ i ]= a[ i ]-'0';
00115   for ( i= 0; i<vb.size(); ++i )
00116         vb[ i ]= b[ i ]-'0';
00117   
00118   return Levenshtein( va, vb );
00119 }

00122 //
00123 // Compute the Levenshtein distance of two strings. Strings 
00124 // must look like "01001001010...".
00125 //
00126 static int Levenshtein( const string &a, const string &b )
00127 {
00128   const char *ca= const_cast<char*>( a.c_str() );
00129   const char *cb= const_cast<char*>( b.c_str() );
00130   
00131   return Levenshtein( ca, cb );
00132 }

00135 // 
00136 // Compute the Levenshtein distance of two integer arrays.
00137 // Arrays must contain a -1 as the last element, eg. { 0,1,1,0,-1 }.
00138 //
00139 int
00140 Metric::Levenshtein( const int *a, const int *b )
00141 {
00142   register unsigned i;
00143   vector< bool > va( arrayLength( a ) + 1 );
00144   vector< bool > vb( arrayLength( b ) + 1 );
00145   
00146   // copy da integer Arrays into the vectors
00147   for ( i= 0; i<va.size(); ++i )
00148         va[ i ]= a[ i ];
00149   for ( i= 0; i<vb.size(); ++i )
00150         vb[ i ]= b[ i ];
00151   
00152   return Levenshtein( va, vb );
00153 }

00164 int 
00165 Metric::Hamming( const vector<bool>& a, const vector<bool>& b )
00166 {
00167   int  x= a.size();
00168   int  y= b.size();
00169   int dH= 0;
00170   
00171   if ( x!=y || x==0 || y==0) {
00172           cerr << "Vectors are of different size or one/both is/are mt. Can't compute Hamming distance!\n";
00173           return -1;
00174   }
00175   while( x-- )
00176         if ( a[--y] != b[y] ) 
00177           dH++;
00178   return( dH );
00179 }

00182 //
00183 // Compute the Hamming distance dH of two strings. Make
00184 // sure that the strings look like "00110101010...".
00185 //
00186 int
00187 Metric::Hamming( const string &a, const string &b )
00188 {
00189   char *ca= const_cast<char*>( a.c_str() );
00190   char *cb= const_cast<char*>( b.c_str() );
00191   
00192   return Hamming( ca, cb );
00193 }

00243 //
00244 // Compute the minimum of three integers.
00245 //
00246 int
00247 Metric::min( const int a, const int b, const int c ) 
00248 {
00249   if ( a<=b  &&  a<=c ) return a;
00250   if ( b<=a  &&  b<=c ) return b;
00251   return c;
00252 }

00255 //
00256 // Compute the number of elements in an integer array. End-of-array
00257 // marker must be a -1.
00258 //
00259 int
00260 Metric::arrayLength( const int *array ) 
00261 {
00262   register int i;               
00263   for ( i= 0; *array!=-1; ++i, ++array ) 
00264         /* mt */ ;
00265   return i;
00266 }
